title: Five or More Criminals Dead in Nuevo Leon
name: Five or More Criminals Dead in Nuevo Leon
description: This data shows where five or more criminals were killed in a single event in Nuevo Leon, Mexico from 09/15/2011 to 12/14/2011.

properties.tacticspecs: The armed men shot at the army vehicles and personnel.
properties.event summary: 09/21/2011:  On Wednesday, in Cienega de Flores, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, five heavily armed men travelling in a Toyota Sienna open fired against the Mexican Army.  The soldiers returned fire and chased the vehicle.  The clash left all five passengers dead.  Authorities seized the weapons from the vehicle.  No damages were reported.  No group claimed responsibility for the armed assault.

09/22/2011: On Thursday afternoon at 1630, in Cienega de Flores, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, soldiers assigned to the 7th Military Zone, IV Military Region, participating in Operacion Noreste, killed five gunmen. The soldiers were responding to a report of armed men in the center of the municipality when they encountered the criminals. The criminals tried to flee in a stolen Toyota Sienna after ramming it into the military vehicle. The criminals drove no further than 50 meters before being killed by the military. The military personnel recovered three shotguns, 995 cartridges of different calibers, 35 magazines for various weapons, one vehicle, one bulletproof vest, three equipment belts, and one ski mask. No group has claimed responsibility for the event and no further damage was reported.

10/16/2011: On Sunday afternoon at 1730 on a road leading to the highway to Paras near San Carlos in Vallecillo, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Federal Officers discovered a drug camp. In a subsequent raid of the drug camp, nine hit men were killed and weapons,  ammunition and three vehicles were recovered. The vehicles included one van, one armored Cheyenne and one armored Grand Cherokee.
